intro: Doliocarpus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered doliocarpus, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashews and mangoes. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it often grows in moist, shaded environments. Doliocarpus multiflorus is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
